You are planning sales meetings with prospective customers M,N,O,P,Q,R for Monday through Friday of a given week At least one meeting must be scheduled each day Only one day has more than one meeting R is scheduled for the only meeting on Wednesday P and Q are scheduled foe meeting exactly on the third day after N M is scheduled earlier in the week than N and O Which of the following must be true?

OPTIONS.OPTION: You meet with N on Monday
You meet with O on Monday
You meet with P on Thursday
You meet with N on Friday

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: The primary purpose of an operating system is:

OPTIONS.OPTION: To make the most efficient use of hardware
To allow people to use the computer
To make computer easier to use

The command interpreter

Is quite different from the JCL interpreter

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: The linker

OPTIONS.OPTION: Is the same as the loader
Is required to create a load module

The time factor when determining the efficiency of algorithm is measured by

OPTIONS.OPTION: Counting the number of key operations

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: The space factor when determining the efficiency of algorithm is measured by

OPTIONS.OPTION: Counting the maximum memory needed by the algorithm
Counting the minimum memory needed by the algorithm

Which statement about database views is true?

OPTIONS.OPTION: A view can be created as read only.
A view cannot have an ORDER BY clause in the SELECT statement.
A view cannot be created with a GROUP BY clause in the SELECT statement.
A view must have aliases defined for the column names in the SELECT statement.

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Examine the structure of the EMPLOYEES table: EMPLOYEE_ID NUMBER Primary Key FIRST_NAME VARCHAR2 (25) LAST_NAME VARCHAR2 (25) Which statement from below will insert a row into the table?

Examine the description of the EMPLOYEES table: EMP_ID NUMBER(4) NOT NULL LAST_NAME VARCHAR2(30) NOT NULL FIRST_NAME VARCHAR2(30) DEPT_ID NUMBER(2) JOB_CAT VARCHARD2(30) SALARY NUMBER(8,2) Which statement shows the maximum salary paid in each job category of each department?

OPTIONS.OPTION: SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees WHERE salary > MAX(salary);
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY dept_id, job_cat;
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees;
SELECT dept_id, job_cat, MAX(salary) FROM employees GROUP BY dept_id;

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: The employee information in a company is stored in the relation Employee (name, sex, salary, deptName) Consider the following SQL query Select deptName From Employee Where sex = 'M' Group by deptName Having avg(salary) > (select avg (salary) from Employee); It returns the names of the department in which

OPTIONS.OPTION: the average salary is more than the average salary in the company
the average salary of male employees is more than the average salary of all male employees in the company
the average salary of male employees is more than the average salary of employees in the same department.
the average salary of male employees is more than the average salary in the company

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: B+ or B-trees are preferred to binary trees in databases because

OPTIONS.OPTION: Disk capacities are greater than memory capacities
Disk access is much slower than memory access
Disk data transfer rates are much less than memory data transfer rates
Disks are more reliable than memory

OPTIONS.OPTION: Constraints enforce rules at the view level.
Constraints enforce rules at the table level.
Constraints prevent the deletion of a table if there are dependencies.

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Which statement correctly describe the functions and use of constraints?

OPTIONS.OPTION: Constraints enforce rules at the view level.
Constraints prevent the deletion of an index if there are dependencies.

binding computers to a domain name

What would be the minimum size of the packet the transport layer needs to keep up, If it wishes to implement a datagram service above the network layer & needs to keep its overhead to maximum of 12.5 % (Assuming no transport layer overhead.)

OPTIONS.OPTION: Will depend upon number synchronization bits required between two characters
